channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: There are a lot of severe potholes in the middle of the road from where Kyderminster Rd joins Greet Road and all the way around. They have noticeably deteriorated since Sep 2025 and are proving dangerous to cars - it's becoming difficult to drive there, 2nd February
item.description:
From where Kyderminster Road joins Greet Road and round towards Huddleston Road. Worst near Greet Road.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kyderminster Road, Winchcombe, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Deep pothole approx 25 inches by 15 inches, 2nd February
item.description:
On the hill down towards the green dragon pub on the Elmstone side. Left hand side of the road.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Elkstone, Cotswold
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: TMC - Defects -CW6 Potholes problem, 2nd February
item.description:
Pothole CW 500mm x 400mm x 44mm Give and take TM Manor Cottage (CW6 Pothole)
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Multiple potholes, 2nd February
item.description:
Multiple potholes in this location, looks like previously repaired but have opened up again. Right in the tyre tracks and where the road narrows down so quite difficult to avoid and some vehicles move towards the oncoming traffic on a blind corner making it quite dangerous. Should be properly repaired.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Church Road, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: TMC - Defects -CW6 Potholes problem, 2nd February
item.description:
2 way stop an go 28 day CARRIAGE WAY POTHOLE 1200X1000X40MM TARMAC PATCH stats required (CW6 Pothole)
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Double pot hole on Alstone Lane, 2nd February
item.description:
The pot hole is before Bryanstone Close if you are travelling towards the train tracks. It is big and hard to see at night. I hit the pothole traveling at c. 20mph on Friday evening and it has burst the tyre on my car.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 129, Alstone Lane, Wymans Brook, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: TMC - Defects -CW6 Potholes problem, 2nd February
item.description:

item.title: Possible sinkhole developing around pothole at the junction of Old Bath Rd and Leckhampton Rd, 2nd February
item.description:
Water is visibly flowing out of the hole through the cracks and road surface. Road surface visibly dropped and the hole has got bigger of the last 5 days
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Leckhampton Road, Leckhampton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Number of potholes, dangerous in depth and likely to cause damage to vehicles, 2nd February
item.description:
Between 111 Leckhampton Road and the junction of Treelands Drive there are a number of long and deep holes along the edge of a utility trench that was filled in a while ago. The edges of the trench have degraded making driving along the road towards Bath Road dangerous especially when vehicles are travelling in the opposite direction and cars are parked. They are virtually impossible to avoid.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 138a, Leckhampton Road, Leckhampton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

item.title: TMC - Defects - Kerbs and Channels problem, 2nd February
item.description:

Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Number of potholes from 1 Chatsworth Drive towards the junction at Leckhampton Road. Loose material, sub base and stones being constantly moved, 2nd February
item.description:
Area of road between 1 Chatsworth Drive and the entrance to 196 Leckhampton Road. Loose stones and debris has increased as the edges of the holes degrade.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 20, Chatsworth Drive, Leckhampton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Loose manhole cover rattling each time a vehicle drives over it. It has been getting progressively worse over the last few weeks, 2nd February
item.description:
Centre of Leckhampton Road at the junction of Chatsworth Drive
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 194, Leckhampton Road, Leckhampton, Cheltenham
